Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of possible lotus flower with added white and added red above band of dots between pairs of white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of hair, spiral and wing with two faded red dots remaining) to left.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 289, no. 867, pl. 119)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1022) (phase 2)
